meets_user_needs.title: As a UK resident, I need to to apply for a council discount or reduction, so that I can get help with paying my council tax (100228)

details.goal: to apply for a council discount or reduction
details.benefit: I can get help with paying my council tax
met_when: understands how to apply for a council tax reduction
understands how to apply for a council tax discount
can calculate the amount
knows the penalties for fraud and keeping overpayments
justifications: It's something only government does
The government is legally obliged to provide it
It's something that people can do or it's something people need to know before they can do something that's regulated by/related to government
It's something the government provides/does/pays for

meets_user_needs.title: As a an ill or disabled person, I need to claim employment and support allowance, so that so I can get financial help to assist me with work or if I can't work (100146)

details.benefit: so I can get financial help to assist me with work or if I can't work
met_when: understands employment support allowance
knows the eligibility criteria for employment support allowance
knows how much they would be entitled to if they qualify for employment support allowance
knows how to claim employment support allowance
knows how to appeal to the Social Security and Child Support Tribunal
knows about Benefit Integrity Centre claim reviews
knows the penalties for fraud and keeping overpayments
understand how care and support is changing
knows payment options
knows may get a home visit to check your benefit payment for a survey
justifications: It's something only government does
The government is legally obliged to provide it
It's inherent to a person's or an organisation's rights and obligations
There is clear demand for it from users
It's something the government provides/does/pays for

meets_user_needs.title: As a carer, I need to get financial help, so that I can carry on looking after the person I care for (100232)

details.benefit: I can carry on looking after the person I care for
met_when: understands what carer's allowance is
understand the eligibility for carer's allowance
can apply for carer's allowance
understands how much carer's allowance they are entitled to
knows when they're claiming too much benefit
knows how to appeal to the Social Security and Child Support Tribunal
knows the penalties for fraud and keeping overpayments
Understands how care and support is changing
knows payment options
can contact Carers UK
can contact the Carers Allowance Unit
justifications: It's something only government does
The government is legally obliged to provide it
There is clear demand for it from users
It's something the government provides/does/pays for

met_when: knows who can claim Child Benefit

knows how to find their child benefit number
knows when they'll get paid child benefit
justifications: It's something only government does
There is clear demand for it from users
It's something the government provides/does/pays for

organisations.description: The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare, pensions and child maintenance policy. As the UK’s biggest public service department it administers the State Pension and a range of working age, disability and ill health benefits to around 20 million claimants and customers. DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 15 agencies and public bodies .

available_translations.title: Benefits calculators
available_translations.description: Find out what benefits you could get, how much you could get and how to claim

description: Find out what benefits you could get, how much you could get and how to claim

details.body:
Use an independent benefits calculator to find out:

  • what benefits you could get
  • how to claim
  • how your benefits will be affected if you start work

These are free to use, anonymous, and have replaced the Benefits Adviser service.

Calculators

Use one of the following:

  • Turn2us - for information on income-related benefits, tax credits, Council Tax Reduction, Carer’s Allowance, Universal Credit and how your benefits will be affected if you start work or change your working hours
  • Policy in Practice - for information on income-related benefits, tax credits, contribution-based benefits, Council Tax Reduction, Carer’s Allowance, Universal Credit, how these are calculated and how your benefits will be affected if you start work or change your working hours
  • entitledto - for information on income-related benefits, tax credits, contribution-based benefits, Council Tax Reduction, Carer’s Allowance, Universal Credit and how your benefits will be affected if you start work

What you’ll need

You’ll need accurate information about your:

  • savings
  • income, including your partner’s (from payslips, for example)
  • existing benefits and pensions (including anyone living with you)
  • outgoings (such as rent, mortgage, childcare payments)
  • council tax bill

Who cannot use them

You cannot use the calculators if you’re under 18, and they will not give accurate results if you’re:

  • a prisoner
  • a student
  • not a British or Irish citizen
  • on strike
  • living outside the UK
  • living permanently in residential care or a nursing home
